summary: The Overtime Wages Tax Relief Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a deduction for overtime compensation. This deduction is capped at $10,000 for individuals and $20,000 for joint filers, with the deduction reduced based on modified adjusted gross income exceeding $100,000/$200,000.  The bill defines overtime compensation, outlines regulations for implementation, and makes conforming amendments to reflect the new deduction. It also addresses reporting, withholding, and provides an effective date for the changes: taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
